I think our definition of 3D development is different here. Autodesk is a software company. Autodesk grows the toolbox. Apple, Google, Microsoft, and Oculus all use Autodesk software in their 3D development pipelines. They’re building the environments, hardware, and UIs behind the 3D experiences and managing the GPU Lidar data on your self driving car etc. Maya, 3DS Max, Fusion, Autocad, Revit, Shotgun, Bim360, are industry standards that support those far reaching endeavors. Autodesk provides the platform.

Based on the examples given by the OP, my hunch was the focus is on 3D reconstruction from images (and perhaps depth maps). I will classify Maya, 3D Max, etc as 3D modeling tools and not 3D reconstruction tools. One of the Autodesk products that fall in 3D reconstruction category (it’s quite nice and I have experimented with it a lot) is 123D Catch/Recap360 and all its incarnations. The examples I have given  from Oculus for example is to highlight their strength in real-time scalable 3D reconstruction on the fly. For 3D modeling tools, of course Autodesk develops the tools that you mentioned that’s used industry wide.

I come from the sales side but Autodesk pays well and has a wondrous work life balance. Full week holidays twice a year for the whole company plus your standard vacation. We’ve invested heavily in the growth of 3D development in all its forms. Manufacturing, construction, product design and even the M&E fun stuff like VR, VFX, live rendering, and games. Depending on what software/industry/support arm you’re in, I see a lot of Python, Ruby, JavaScript, and C++. There is a strong argument for Autodesk being the front runner in 3D software and with the SaaS model taking hold, projected revenue isn’t a big mystery. Investors love that. Construction is very sensitive to a recession so that can create a potential threat down the road given Autodesk’s investment but with the global economy steaming forward, things are great. You will see some pretty cool products coming forward in the next two years.
